initial_story:
Thanks for joining our live coverage on an extraordinary day in court, with adult-film star Stormy Daniels taking the stand.

It was a tense courtroom, with Daniels warned to dial back her comments at times. Prosecutors were also told to limit their questions regarding the salacious details of her alleged sexual encounter with Trump (which Trump has denied ever took place).

Here's our full wrap of what happened in court today.

This page was edited by Tiffany Wertheimer, Lisa Lambert, Brandon Livesay and Phil McCausland. The writers were Sam Hancock and Sean Seddon, and we had Madeline Halpert and Kayla Epstein in court.

Court doesn't sit on Wednesday, so we'll be back on Thursday, when Stormy Daniels will once again take to the stand to continue her testimony.

The atmosphere is charged, with Johnson's attorneys urging her to be cautious with her words, while prosecutors are advised to tread lightly when questioning her about the alleged white-collar crime (which the defendant firmly denies).

Our team of dedicated journalists, including Tiffany Wertheimer, Lisa Lambert, Brandon Livesay, and Phil McCausland, will bring you comprehensive coverage of the day's events. Stay informed with insightful reporting from Sam Hancock and Sean Seddon, as our team on the ground, Madeline Halpert and Kayla Epstein, provide real-time updates from the courthouse.

With the trial taking a break on Wednesday, we'll be back on Thursday for another day of intense testimony from Sara Johnson. Make sure to stay tuned for the latest developments in this closely watched case.
